summary: Shared transcripts are read-only copies of your Cursor chat conversations that you can share via a link. They let you collaborate on solutions, document debugging sessions, or showcase problem-solving.
key_takeaways: Share with Team visibility (requires sign-in) or Public visibility (anyone with link).
Cursor automatically redacts potential secrets like API keys and passwords.
Recipients can fork shared chats to continue in their own Cursor.
Shared transcripts are available for Pro, Business, and Enterprise users.

questions.question: What visibility options are available when sharing a Cursor transcript?
questions.explanation: You can share with Team visibility (only team members can view, requires sign-in) or Public visibility (anyone with the link can view).

questions.question: What happens when someone forks a shared transcript?

options.text: A copy is created that they can continue in their own Cursor
They gain edit access to the original

questions.explanation: Forking creates a copy of the conversation that opens in the recipient's Cursor, ready for them to continue. The original shared transcript remains unchanged.

questions.question: Why might you be unable to create shared transcripts even on a paid plan?

options.text: You have Privacy Mode set to 'No Storage'

questions.explanation: Users with Privacy Mode set to 'No Storage' cannot create shared transcripts because the feature requires storing conversation data. Adjust your privacy settings to enable sharing.
